TopicTitle: What's your favorite mun/planet in the kerbolsystem?

Articles.Content: Mine is Eve, because it is interesting from a chemical point of view. Also, it is supposed to be a Venus analogue, but it is nothing like Venus. (my second is Kerbin, of course. That's where all the Kerbals live.)
Laythe. I've landed and returned so many spaceplanes there. I also made a floating base there too.
OMGosh that's AWESOME!
Base? that's more like a colony
I have a question. Are the hitchhiker cans docked to the panels or did you land them already attached like that?
They come pre-made. I flew the module in around Jool, and dropped it from the jet frame nearby the base. The movers will move the segments into place.

Calling it: 95% of people in here will say Laythe.

Back to the original topic: Laythe.

Calling it: 95% of people in here will say Laythe.

Yep:D Laythe
The frozen dwarf Eeloo
This, Levelord, is awesome!
Guess I'm gonna have to go to Laythe and see what the fuss is about.
Yep. Laythe. I made my first stock landing yesterday! But Minmus is cool too!

Hehe... What if I say Pol?

I love Pol the most. Spiky rocks everywhere.

I haven't been to the Joolian system yet. As a matter of fact, I'm now planning my trip there, after visiting most of the bodies in the inner Kerbol System. Based on how people describe it, and the snapshots and videos off YouTube that I've seen of it, I think I will like Laythe--like most otherworld dreamers, I have often longed for another place just like the earth, for humans to live and thrive in. And Laythe sounds just like that place.

I hope I don't get disappointed once my Kerbals arrive there soon.

I haven't been to the Joolian system yet. As a matter of fact, I'm now planning my trip there, after visiting most of the bodies in the inner Kerbol System. Based on how people describe it, and the snapshots and videos off YouTube that I've seen of it, I think I will like Laythe--like most otherworld dreamers, I have often longed for another place just like the earth, for humans to live and thrive in. And Laythe sounds just like that place.

I hope I don't get disappointed once my Kerbals arrive there soon.

You best hurry before the devs add volcanism to it
I just love minmus for some reason. And Vall

You best hurry before the devs add volcanism to it

Volcanoes!?! My country is an archipelago that is full of volcanoes, some active, some extinct and some dormant, and I have personally climbed two of them! Bring them on! I'll love Laythe all the more!
Vall!
I love Vall because its the Europa analogue in KSP. Does somebody else want hydrobots???

Vall's pretty cool, beautiful mountain ranges and weird rocks galore. What's even cooler about Vall is its history: The igneous rocks on its surface point to a volcanic past. At some point, Vall might have been an Io-like molten rock with absurd amounts of vulcanism, but a gravitational ballet moved it into a higher orbit, freezing it. However, my favorite body is Minmus. It has low gravity, fun cliffs to slide down, and it's the only body where you can see the Mun eclipse Kerbin. I usually send a crew returning from a long stint at my Eve base up there on vacation.

I'm one of those oddballs who really likes Gilly. The low gravity makes for interesting challenges when trying to do anything on its surface, but also makes for some fantastic fun when ragdolling your Kerbals or playing Rocket Ping-Pong.
I'm yet to visit all of them. I'm currenty favoring Tylo. Just made a landing and reorbit there. KErban sized moon with no atmo to slow you dowe, nice.

Vall is likely my favorite, it's so beautiful. I've never been there though, save one impactor totally on accident. Yes, I ran INTO a freaking planet..

Really though, I'd have to say Kerbin. It's been the home of all my half-baked experiments...

Visited: Eve. Pretty colors.

Not Yet Visited: Laythe. Most interesting little bugger in the system.

I really like the color of Eve, and I like the oceans of Laythe, but I've just finished building a base on Minmus and I've really fallen in love with it.

Minmus has some fantastic terrain, and the color is so pleasant - it feels like a blue beach in space. I built my base on a plateau about 3km above "sea" level, overlooking a cliff. I have not seen anything like that on Laythe, and I haven't seen enough of Eve to rule it out there, but I doubt there is something that good there.
